intro: Physospermum commutatum, commonly known as the common physospermum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
